full_summary:
=================
# Architectural and Engineering (A&E) Services 
### Brand Correctorial Work for IOC Codes Deficiencies

#### Public Tender Notice

 Reference Number: PW-22-01015987
 Solicitation Number: 202301325

### Project Overview
The Royal Canadian Mounted Police (RCMP) requires the services of a multidisciplinary team to deliver code deficiency upgrades in Ottawa, ON. The proposal seeks to engage a consultant for architectural and engineering services.

### Proposal Overview
* **Project Background**: The RCMP aims to address code deficiencies in its buildings to ensure compliance with current building codes.
* **Key Objectives**: The consultant will provide a comprehensive assessment of the building deficiencies, develop a project implementation plan, and provide architectural and engineering services to rectify the identified issues.
* **Duration**: The contract will span 31 months, ending on July 31, 2025.

### Procurement
Procurement Method: Competitive – Open bidding

### Language
Languages allowed for document submission: English or French.

### Agreement
The Crown retains the right to negotiate with the contractor.

### Contact Information
Contact Person: Leach, Brianne
 Email: [Brianne.Leach@rcmp-grc.gc.ca](mailto:Brianne.Leach@rcmp-grc.gc.gc.ca)
### Documents and Amendments
Documents and amendments are available on the GETS service provider website: [http://buyandsell.gc.ca/procurement-data/tenders](http://buyandsell.gc.ca/procurement-data/tenders)

**Important Information**: RCMP has adopted the Integrity Regime administered by PSPC. The integrity provisions will be applied as outlined in the solicitation.

### Closing Date and Time
2023-01-27 14:00:00 AST

Note to the Work:
The contractor needs to find a way to make it clear that there is no one standing between them and the government hence with regards to the notices of communication. This can be the case for the list of arrows and buttons on the document's attachment page or on the post.

visual support. You included any necessary information for a contractor to
know how to proceed.

Please let me know if there is anything else I can do for you.
